title: ion-item
body: Items are elements that can contain text, icons, avatars, images, inputs, and any other native or custom elements. Generally they are placed in a list with other items. Items can be swiped, deleted, reordered, edited, and more.
An item is considered "clickable" if it has an
property set. Clickable items have a few visual differences that indicate they can be interacted with. For example, a clickable item receives the ripple effect upon activation in
mode, has a highlight when activated in
will display a right arrow icon on
mode. To hide the right arrow icon on clickable elements, set the
. To show the right arrow icon on an item that doesn't display it naturally, set the
in order to position content. This logic makes it possible to write a complex item with simple, understandable markup without having to worry about styling and positioning the elements.
The below chart details the item slots and where it will place the element inside of the item:
Placed to the left of all other content in LTR, and to the
Placed to the right of all other content in LTR, and to the
Placed inside of the input wrapper.
Items left align text and add an ellipsis when the text is wider than the item. See the
for classes that can be added to
Items containing an input will highlight the bottom border of the input with a different color when focused, valid, or invalid. By default,
items have a highlight with a height set to
has no highlight (technically the height is set to
). The height can be changed using the
CSS property. To turn off the highlight, set this variable to
. For more information on setting CSS properties, see the
The highlight color changes based on the item state, but all of the states use Ionic colors by default. When focused, the input highlight will use the
color. If the input is valid it will use the
color, and invalid inputs will use the
section below for the highlight color variables.

props.name: button
props.docs: If true, a button tag will be rendered and the item will be tappable.

props.name: color
props.docs: The color to use from your application's color palette. Default options are: "primary", "secondary", "tertiary", "success", "warning", "danger", "light", "medium", and "dark". For more information on colors, see theming.

props.name: detail
props.docs: If true, a detail arrow will appear on the item. Defaults to false unless the mode is ios and an href or button property is present.

props.name: detailIcon
props.docs: The icon to use when detail is set to true.

props.name: disabled
props.docs: If true, the user cannot interact with the item.

props.name: download
props.docs: This attribute instructs browsers to download a URL instead of navigating to it, so the user will be prompted to save it as a local file. If the attribute has a value, it is used as the pre-filled file name in the Save prompt (the user can still change the file name if they want).

props.name: href
props.docs: Contains a URL or a URL fragment that the hyperlink points to. If this property is set, an anchor tag will be rendered.

props.name: lines
props.docs: How the bottom border should be displayed on the item.

props.name: mode
props.docs: The mode determines which platform styles to use.

props.name: rel
props.docs: Specifies the relationship of the target object to the link object. The value is a space-separated list of link types.

props.name: routerDirection
props.docs: When using a router, it specifies the transition direction when navigating to another page using href.

props.name: target
props.docs: Specifies where to display the linked URL. Only applies when an href is provided. Special keywords: "_blank", "_self", "_parent", "_top".

props.name: type
props.docs: The type of the button. Only used when an onclick or button property is present.

docs: Items are elements that can contain text, icons, avatars, images, inputs, and any other native or custom elements. Generally they are placed in a list with other items. Items can be swiped, deleted, reordered, edited, and more.

docsTags.text: {"ios" | "md"} mode - The mode determines which platform styles to use.
docsTags.name: virtualProp

docsTags.text: - Content is placed between the named slots if provided without a slot.
docsTags.name: slot

docsTags.text: start - Content is placed to the left of the item text in LTR, and to the right in RTL.
docsTags.name: slot

docsTags.text: end - Content is placed to the right of the item text in LTR, and to the left in RTL.
docsTags.name: slot

docsTags.text: detail-icon - The chevron icon for the item. Only applies when `detail="true"`.
docsTags.name: part

styles.name: --background
styles.docs: Background of the item

styles.name: --background-activated
styles.docs: Background of the item when pressed. Note: setting this will interfere with the Material Design ripple.

styles.name: --background-activated-opacity
styles.docs: Opacity of the item background when pressed

styles.name: --background-focused
styles.docs: Background of the item when focused with the tab key

styles.name: --background-focused-opacity
styles.docs: Opacity of the item background when focused with the tab key

styles.name: --background-hover
styles.docs: Background of the item on hover

styles.name: --background-hover-opacity
styles.docs: Opacity of the background of the item on hover

styles.name: --border-color
styles.docs: Color of the item border

styles.name: --border-radius
styles.docs: Radius of the item border

styles.name: --border-style
styles.docs: Style of the item border

styles.name: --border-width
styles.docs: Width of the item border

styles.name: --color
styles.docs: Color of the item

styles.name: --color-activated
styles.docs: Color of the item when pressed

styles.name: --color-focused
styles.docs: Color of the item when focused with the tab key

styles.name: --color-hover
styles.docs: Color of the item on hover

styles.name: --detail-icon-color
styles.docs: Color of the item detail icon

styles.name: --detail-icon-font-size
styles.docs: Font size of the item detail icon

styles.name: --detail-icon-opacity
styles.docs: Opacity of the item detail icon

styles.name: --highlight-color-focused
styles.docs: The color of the highlight on the item when focused

styles.name: --highlight-color-invalid
styles.docs: The color of the highlight on the item when invalid

styles.name: --highlight-color-valid
styles.docs: The color of the highlight on the item when valid

styles.name: --highlight-height
styles.docs: The height of the highlight on the item

styles.name: --inner-border-width
styles.docs: Width of the item inner border

styles.name: --inner-box-shadow
styles.docs: Box shadow of the item inner

styles.name: --inner-padding-bottom
styles.docs: Bottom padding of the item inner

styles.name: --inner-padding-end
styles.docs: Right padding if direction is left-to-right, and left padding if direction is right-to-left of the item inner

styles.name: --inner-padding-start
styles.docs: Left padding if direction is left-to-right, and right padding if direction is right-to-left of the item inner

styles.name: --inner-padding-top
styles.docs: Top padding of the item inner

styles.name: --min-height
styles.docs: Minimum height of the item

styles.name: --padding-bottom
styles.docs: Bottom padding of the item

styles.name: --padding-end
styles.docs: Right padding if direction is left-to-right, and left padding if direction is right-to-left of the item

styles.name: --padding-start
styles.docs: Left padding if direction is left-to-right, and right padding if direction is right-to-left of the item

styles.name: --padding-top
styles.docs: Top padding of the item

styles.name: --ripple-color
styles.docs: Color of the item ripple effect

styles.name: --transition
styles.docs: Transition of the item

slots.docs: Content is placed between the named slots if provided without a slot.

slots.name: end
slots.docs: Content is placed to the right of the item text in LTR, and to the left in RTL.

slots.name: start
slots.docs: Content is placed to the left of the item text in LTR, and to the right in RTL.
